intro: Simaba paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Simaba, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
